com.stormpath.sdk.idsite

Interface IdSiteUrlBuilder


  • public interface IdSiteUrlBuilder
    Helps build a URL you can use to redirect your application users to a hosted login/registration/forgot-password site - what Stormpath calls an 'Identity Site' (or 'ID Site' for short) - for performing common user identity functionality. When the user is done (logging in, registering, etc), they will be redirected back to a callbackUri of your choice.
    Retaining Application State

    If you need to retain application state, such as the location in your UI the user is attempting to visit, and you want that state presented back to you when the user returns from the ID Site, you can use the setState(aString) method. This state will be retained while the user is on the ID Site, and the exact same state will be available when the user returns to your application's callbackUri.

    The state property, while sent over TLS/SSL and cryptographically signed, is guaranteed that it will not be tampered with or manipulated in any way. However, it itself is not additionally encrypted and might be accessible as a URL query parameter for anyone that can see the URL. As such, it is recommended that you do not store secure state in this value unless you encrypt it first.

    Since:
    1.0.RC2
    See Also:
    setCallbackUri(String), setPath(String), setState(String), Application.newIdSiteUrlBuilder(), Application.newIdSiteCallbackHandler(Object)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String build()
      Builds and returns the the fully qualified URL representing the initial location in the ID Site where the end-user should be redirected.

    • Method Detail

      • setCallbackUri

        IdSiteUrlBuilder setCallbackUri(String callbackUri)
        Sets the location where the user will be sent when returning from the ID Site. This property is mandatory and must be set. See the application.newIdSiteCallbackHandler documentation for information on how to process requests to your callbackUri.

        For security reasons, this location must be registered in your ID Site configuration in the Stormpath Admin Console.

        Parameters:
        callbackUri - the final destination where to get the browser redirected.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setState

        IdSiteUrlBuilder setState(String state)
        Sets application-specific state that should be retained and made available to your callbackUri when the user returns from the ID Site.
        Parameters:
        state - application-specific state that should be retained and made available to your callbackUri when the user returns from the ID Site.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setPath

        IdSiteUrlBuilder setPath(String path)
        Sets the initial path in the ID Site where the user should be sent. If unspecified, this defaults to /, implying that the ID Site's landing/home page is the desired location.
        Example

        Most Stormpath customers allow their ID Site's default landing page / to reflect a traditional 'Login or Signup' page for convenience. However, if you know that an end-user is attempting to register, and your ID Site's user registration form is located at /register, you might want to call setPath(&quot;/&quot;) to send the user directly to that view instead.

        Parameters:
        path - the initial path in the ID Site where the user should be sent.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • build

        String build()
        Builds and returns the the fully qualified URL representing the initial location in the ID Site where the end-user should be redirected.
        Returns:
        the the fully qualified URL representing the initial location in the ID Site where the end-user should be redirected.
